episodeTitle: The Python Strikes! The Survival Game Begins!
description: A giant python named Nola attacks the Straw Hat exploration team in Upper Yard, causing them to scatter. Meanwhile, Gan Fall recounts the historical conflict between the Shandia and Sky Island inhabitants, and the Shandia warriors prepare to battle Enel's forces.

events.title: Nola the Giant Python Appears
events.description: The Straw Hat exploration team encounters Nola, a massive python over 200 meters long that has lived in Upper Yard for more than 400 years. The tree roots begin to move, revealing the colossal serpent known as the Master of the Sky.
events.significance: Introduces Nola, a creature with deep historical connections to the Noland-Kalgara friendship and the history of Jaya/Skypiea. Nola serves as a living link to events 400 years in the past.

events.title: Nola Attacks the Exploration Team
events.description: The giant python Nola suddenly attacks the Straw Hat exploration team with incredible speed, attempting to swallow them whole. Its massive size and venomous fangs pose a serious threat to the crew.
events.significance: Forces the crew to split up in Upper Yard, setting the stage for individual encounters with Enel's priests and the Survival Game. This separation is a key plot device for the arc.

events.title: Exploration Team Scatters
events.description: Due to Nola's attack, Luffy, Robin, Chopper, and Zoro are forced to split up while navigating through the forest of Upper Yard. The team becomes separated as they try to escape the giant python.
events.significance: This separation leads to individual character moments and encounters with different enemies in the Survival Game, allowing for parallel storylines throughout the arc.

events.title: Gan Fall Explains the Shandia-Sky Island War
events.description: Gan Fall recounts to the remaining Straw Hats the 400-year history of conflict between the Shandia people and Sky Island inhabitants. He explains how the Shandia were the original inhabitants of Upper Yard before it was knocked up to the sky, and how they've been fighting to reclaim their homeland ever since.
events.significance: Provides crucial context for understanding the Skypiea conflict. This history parallels themes of displacement, inherited will, and the fight for one's homeland that recur throughout One Piece. The story also sets up the Noland-Kalgara flashback.

quotes.text: The Shandia were the original inhabitants of Upper Yard. They were driven out of their land and the Sky Islanders possessed it for selfish interest.
quotes.speaker: Gan Fall
quotes.context: Explaining the root of the 400-year war

events.title: Explanation of Enel's Arrival and Rule
events.description: Gan Fall reveals that Enel arrived on Skypiea six years ago with his priests and took control. He explains how some enforcers seized by Enel escape via ship and are ultimately defeated by the Shandia, which is why the Straw Hats were initially attacked.
events.significance: Clarifies the current political situation in Skypiea and explains the three-way conflict between Enel's forces, the Shandia, and the Sky Islanders. This information helps contextualize the Survival Game and the motivations of different factions.

quotes.text: Enel arrived on Skypiea six years ago, with his priests.
quotes.speaker: Gan Fall
quotes.context: Explaining how Enel came to power

events.title: Shandia Chief Appears
events.description: The Shandia Chief makes his first appearance, shown as the wise and elderly leader of the Shandia tribe. He is depicted as a peaceful and honorable man, respected by his people.
events.significance: Introduces the leader of the Shandia people who has guided them through decades of conflict. The Chief serves as a keeper of the tribe's history and connection to Kalgara's legacy.

events.title: Isa Debuts
events.description: Isa, a Shandia woman and mother of Aisa, makes her first appearance in conversation with Raki about Aisa and Wyper. She is shown as a caring mother concerned about her daughter.
events.significance: Introduces Aisa's mother, adding depth to the Shandia community by showing family relationships. Isa's concern for Aisa foreshadows later events in the arc.

events.title: Shandia Warriors Prepare for Battle
events.description: Wyper and the Shandia warriors make the decision to move out and attack Upper Yard, with the goal of reaching God's Shrine to defeat Enel and reclaim their homeland.
events.significance: Sets the Shandia's plan in motion for the Survival Game. This decision puts them on a collision course with both Enel's forces and the Straw Hats, creating the complex multi-faction conflict that defines the arc's climax.

events.title: The Survival Game Officially Begins
events.description: The episode establishes that the Survival Game has officially begun, with multiple factions - the Straw Hats, Shandia warriors, and Enel's priests - all converging on Upper Yard with different objectives.
events.significance: Marks the official start of the major conflict phase of the Skypiea Arc. The 'Survival Game' becomes a key narrative structure for the next several episodes, with battles occurring simultaneously across Upper Yard.

quotes.text: The Shandia were the original inhabitants of Upper Yard. They were driven out of their land and the Sky Islanders possessed it for selfish interest.
quotes.speaker: Gan Fall
quotes.context: Explaining the history of the Shandia-Sky Island conflict

quotes.text: Enel arrived on Skypiea six years ago, with his priests.
quotes.speaker: Gan Fall
quotes.context: Revealing how Enel came to power

themes.description: The episode explores the concept of inherited will through the 400-year war between the Shandia and Sky Islanders. The current generation continues fighting for their ancestors' cause, showing how conflict and dreams pass down through generations.
themes.symbolism: Nola represents a living connection to the past, having witnessed the original friendship between Noland and Kalgara 400 years ago.

themes.description: The Shandia's fight to reclaim Upper Yard parallels real-world themes of displacement and the struggle for one's homeland. The episode emphasizes the importance of ancestral land and cultural identity.
themes.symbolism: Upper Yard/Shandora represents not just land but cultural heritage, history, and the memories of ancestors.

themes.description: Through Gan Fall's exposition and Nola's appearance, the episode shows how the past continues to affect the present. Characters are shaped by events that occurred centuries before they were born.
themes.symbolism: The ancient forest of Upper Yard and Nola's age represent the endurance of history.

characterSpotlights.development: Gan Fall serves as the voice of reason and history, helping the Straw Hats understand the complex situation in Skypiea. His exposition reveals his deep knowledge of the conflict and his sympathetic view of the Shandia's plight.
keyActions: Recounts the 400-year history of the Shandia-Sky Island war
Explains Enel's arrival and takeover six years ago
Clarifies why the Straw Hats were attacked by the Shandia
quotes: The Shandia were the original inhabitants of Upper Yard. They were driven out of their land and the Sky Islanders possessed it for selfish interest.

characterSpotlights.development: Nola is introduced as a fearsome predator but is revealed to be a creature with deep emotional connections to the past. Having lived for over 400 years, Nola is one of the few remaining witnesses to the original friendship between Noland and Kalgara.
keyActions: Emerges from the forest to attack the exploration team
Scatters the Straw Hats across Upper Yard

characterSpotlights.role: Shandia warrior leader preparing for battle
characterSpotlights.development: Wyper is shown preparing the Shandia warriors for their assault on Upper Yard, demonstrating his role as a fierce leader determined to reclaim his people's homeland.
keyActions: Prepares to march on Upper Yard to defeat Enel

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands on Gan Fall's historical exposition compared to the manga, adding more dialogue and visual flashbacks to help clarify the complex political situation.
Nola's attack sequence is extended in the anime with additional action scenes showing the python's speed and the crew's reactions.

trivia.fact: Episode 168 is the last episode to feature 'Hikari e' by The Babystars as the opening theme and 'FAITH' by Ruppina as the ending theme. Starting with Episode 169, the opening changes to 'Bon Voyage!' by Bon-Bon Blanco and the ending changes to 'A to Z~ONE PIECE Edition~' by ZZ.
Nola is named after Mont Blanc Noland, the explorer who befriended the snake's ancestors over 400 years ago. The name was given by the Shandia as a tribute to Noland after he left Jaya.
Nola is the second-oldest living being in One Piece at over 400 years old, with only Zunesha being older at over 1,000 years.
This episode adapts material from Chapters 255 and 256 of the manga.
The Shandia Chief is the only character to remain unnamed despite receiving a full character card in the Vivre Card – One Piece Visual Dictionary.
